reviews.review:
This game would have been okay if it was free or 4 dollars, but its honestly a rip off and a cash grab. I pay 20.00 dollars for a game that has content, not for a game that a glorified battle pass underneath it and skins you have to buy with real money, they don't even lie to you and tell you can work for the skins with in game currency, they just want your money. 

The game is only fun for the first five rounds then gets boring and tedious afterwards. For a game that is basically tag, I would have to rate it 1/10. DON'T buy this game. Get a game that actually gives you and your friends real joy, not a joke of a game that only wants you for your money.

FIRST IMPRESSIONS: i'm a new player and not particularly competitive in DBD, so take this with a grain of salt and more as a "first impression" type of review.

are there matches that are more frustrating than fun? yes of course, it's a pvp game, but i've never been tilted like i have in other games(speaking as an ex-Overwatch addict). any frustration is always outweighed by the survivors or killers with a sense of humour.
the lack of voice chat means all communication is expressed in-game in a variety of scuffed, but always amusing, ways. rapid headshakes or nods, crouching, pointing, etc... it's a good time and i think it's perfect for this type of game.

my biggest criticism however is the fact that you have to buy new survivors and killers - i understand this is their way of making money, and to be frank, you really don't HAVE to buy anything extra unless maybe you really like one of the franchises on offer. but what you get for free is plenty to start with, and if you're a new player, just hold off on spending any extra money until after you know if you actually enjoy the game.

'Fun game', I think it's decent, the learning curve is ever so steep, so it is quite rare to see new players, bend their own will to continue playing this game, otherwise, i rate it 8/10 Camping bubbas

This game is NOT FUN. Not even in the slightest. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME! The only reason this game continues to have a community is because there have been almost no polished new games released in the last 7 years. It's either this or Fallout 4/Skyrim if you want a game that's polished and has replay value. This game has the absolute most toxic community of players you'll ever encounter. 

The game seems to have been designed to frustrate you in a way that I haven't experienced since the very early days of nintendo when games were frustratingly difficult to the point where you'd want to throw your controller out a window. 

This game is also CURSED. It feeds off the same part of your brain that is susceptible to gambling addiction. That's because for every 10 matches you play 9 will be so awful you're blood pressure will be through the roof. 1 in 10 is fun, but not because of anything the game encourages you to do. The only time this game is ever fun is when players ignore all the objectives and goof around. If you're playing towards any of the objectives you're in for an awful time. 

And it's that same mentality you get when you enter a casino that this game relies upon to keep you playing. Hitting the ready up button is equivalent to dropping another dollar into a slot machine and pulling the lever. Maybe this match will be one of the fun ones, you might even say to yourself. Odds are it isn't. The game devs want you to hate their game because it's that tilting frustration that they rely upon to make you keep playing. 

It's also the worst grind I've ever seen in a game.

YOU WILL NEVER BEAT THIS GAME. No one wins at dbd, only the psychotic devs who charge you $10 for a digital outfit for your character all the while they continue to focus on algorithms that try to keep you playing, even if those algorithms rely on toxic behavior. 

Save yourself the waste of time and wait until 2022-2023 when there might be one or two decent games that come out and are hopefully ACTUALLY FUN. But knowing the CURSE of this game anything that might steer players towards something else will get cancelled or postponed or be abandoned before it can develop into a real game with a solid community. 

I DESPISE this game but there's not a lot of new polished games out there with replay value. 

Don't listen to me and buy it and try it and you'll end up hating it too.

There are so many things to love and dislike about Dead by Daylight. I bought this game at first to purely play as a party game, but soon fell victim to it's allure more so than my group of friends. You can play together with friends as a survivor and try and get some unique plays during your matches and have a great time with your party or play solo (you still can with friends as a killer too, but I find it to be less enjoyable after learning how all of my friends play) as a killer and gradually learn their powers to best take out the survivors. It is best to play both sides in order to understand how things work for greater teamwork throughout your team as a survivor and to be a calculated killer. Playing with friends helps and calls for a great time. There are also not so great things to like about the game. Bugs that have persisted for way too long, a somewhat toxic player base, and general improvements that could be made to make the overall health for the game so much better. Even with my vague gripes with Dead by Daylight, I would recommend it if you like to outplay other players, as that is what this game boils down to for me.
